issue.title: Data not always returned within bounding box
issue.body: ## Expected behavior and actual behavior. Shapes within a bounding box to be returned whatever the size or projection of that bounding box. Instead some of the shapes stop being returned even though the bounding box still contains them, if the projection changes. ## Steps to reproduce the problem. If I request data in EPSG:3857, I get this result: https://tilma.mysociety.org/mapserver/brent?SERVICE=WFS&VERSION=1.1.0&REQUEST=GetFeature&SRSNAME=urn%3Aogc%3Adef%3Acrs%3AEPSG%3A%3A3857&TYPENAME=Parks_and_Open_Spaces&bbox=-24190.549273477,6716902.930357,-23854.942946209,6717123.8811418 If I request the equivalent bounding box in EPSG:27700, I get this result: https://tilma.mysociety.org/mapserver/brent?SERVICE=WFS&VERSION=1.1.0&REQUEST=GetFeature&SRSNAME=urn%3Aogc%3Adef%3Acrs%3AEPSG%3A%3A27700&TYPENAME=Parks_and_Open_Spaces&bbox=523734.4667234342,183556.63528328092,523940.1889593812,183699.01999836136 The 3857 result is missing many of the entries present in the 27700 query (pink is 27700, red is 3857): The .map layer is: ``` LAYER NAME "Parks_and_Open_Spaces" METADATA "wfs_title" "parks_and_spaces" ##REQUIRED "wfs_srs" "EPSG:3857 EPSG:27700" ## REQUIRED "gml_include_items" "site_name" "gml_featureid" "site_name" ## REQUIRED "wfs_enable_request" "*" "wfs_getfeature_formatlist" "geojson" END TYPE POLYGON STATUS ON DATA 'brent/parks_and_open_spaces_poly' PROJECTION "init=epsg:27700" END END ``` and the source data is: [brent-parks.zip](https://github.com/MapServer/MapServer/files/13180576/brent-parks.zip) ## Operating system Debian bullseye ## MapServer version and installation method 7.6.2, Debian bullseye package If we run the same query on MapServer 7.2.2 (Debian buster), then we receive full results, 15 more entries in the 3857 response. No changes to data or map file.

comment.body: In EPSG:32630 with equivalent co-ordinates (692979.2296026859,5713254.965024991)-(693183.0386342288,5713400.188730145) it returns only 11 results, even fewer than EPSG:3857.

issue.title: Data not always returned within bounding box
issue.body: ## Expected behavior and actual behavior. Shapes within a bounding box to be returned whatever the size or projection of that bounding box. Instead some of the shapes stop being returned even though the bounding box still contains them, if the projection changes. ## Steps to reproduce the problem. If I request data in EPSG:3857, I get this result: https://tilma.mysociety.org/mapserver/brent?SERVICE=WFS&VERSION=1.1.0&REQUEST=GetFeature&SRSNAME=urn%3Aogc%3Adef%3Acrs%3AEPSG%3A%3A3857&TYPENAME=Parks_and_Open_Spaces&bbox=-24190.549273477,6716902.930357,-23854.942946209,6717123.8811418 If I request the equivalent bounding box in EPSG:27700, I get this result: https://tilma.mysociety.org/mapserver/brent?SERVICE=WFS&VERSION=1.1.0&REQUEST=GetFeature&SRSNAME=urn%3Aogc%3Adef%3Acrs%3AEPSG%3A%3A27700&TYPENAME=Parks_and_Open_Spaces&bbox=523734.4667234342,183556.63528328092,523940.1889593812,183699.01999836136 The 3857 result is missing many of the entries present in the 27700 query (pink is 27700, red is 3857): The .map layer is: ``` LAYER NAME "Parks_and_Open_Spaces" METADATA "wfs_title" "parks_and_spaces" ##REQUIRED "wfs_srs" "EPSG:3857 EPSG:27700" ## REQUIRED "gml_include_items" "site_name" "gml_featureid" "site_name" ## REQUIRED "wfs_enable_request" "*" "wfs_getfeature_formatlist" "geojson" END TYPE POLYGON STATUS ON DATA 'brent/parks_and_open_spaces_poly' PROJECTION "init=epsg:27700" END END ``` and the source data is: [brent-parks.zip](https://github.com/MapServer/MapServer/files/13180576/brent-parks.zip) ## Operating system Debian bullseye ## MapServer version and installation method 7.6.2, Debian bullseye package If we run the same query on MapServer 7.2.2 (Debian buster), then we receive full results, 15 more entries in the 3857 response. No changes to data or map file.

comment.body:
I know that my comment lacks relevance, in a way. But by the WFS 1.1.0 standard GetFeature with `&bbox=-24190.549273477,6716902.930357,-23854.942946209,6717123.8811418` should not find anything because if bbox is expressed with 4 parameters then the coordinates should be in WGS84 units and lat-lon axis order and obviously those are not. The standard compliant way is to include SRID as a fifth parameter `&bbox=-24190.549273477,6716902.930357,-23854.942946209,6717123.8811418,urn:ogc:def:crs:EPSG::3857`. However, Mapserver does not interpret the 4-parameter bbox to mean WGS84 coordinates but either the units of the default coordinate system, or if &SRSNAME= is used then those units. Your usage of bbox is correct for Mapserver and obviously there is a bug somewhere.

EPSG:27700 makes often troubles. For getting more info, could you test also with for example UTM Zone 30N (EPSG:32630)?

comment.body:
Thanks for your reply, but not sure I understand the relevance, sorry. MapServer does support bbox, it works fine in a previous version, and I get the same (different) results if I use it in a filter:
* 3857: https://tilma.mysociety.org/mapserver/brent?SERVICE=WFS&VERSION=1.1.0&REQUEST=GetFeature&SRSNAME=urn%3Aogc%3Adef%3Acrs%3AEPSG%3A%3A3857&TYPENAME=Parks_and_Open_Spaces&filter=%3CFilter%3E%3CBBOX%3E%3Cgml:Box%20srsName=%22EPSG:3857%22%3E%3Cgml:coordinates%3E-24190.549273477,6716902.930357%20-23854.942946209,6717123.8811418%3C/gml:coordinates%3E%3C/gml:Box%3E%3C/BBOX%3E%3C/Filter%3E - 14 results
* 27700: https://tilma.mysociety.org/mapserver/brent?SERVICE=WFS&VERSION=1.1.0&REQUEST=GetFeature&SRSNAME=urn%3Aogc%3Adef%3Acrs%3AEPSG%3A%3A27700&TYPENAME=Parks_and_Open_Spaces&filter=%3CFilter%3E%3CBBOX%3E%3Cgml:Box%20srsName=%22EPSG:27700%22%3E%3Cgml:coordinates%3E523734.4667234342,183556.63528328092%20523940.1889593812,183699.01999836136%3C/gml:coordinates%3E%3C/gml:Box%3E%3C/BBOX%3E%3C/Filter%3E - 29 results

issue.title: Data not always returned within bounding box
issue.body: ## Expected behavior and actual behavior. Shapes within a bounding box to be returned whatever the size or projection of that bounding box. Instead some of the shapes stop being returned even though the bounding box still contains them, if the projection changes. ## Steps to reproduce the problem. If I request data in EPSG:3857, I get this result: https://tilma.mysociety.org/mapserver/brent?SERVICE=WFS&VERSION=1.1.0&REQUEST=GetFeature&SRSNAME=urn%3Aogc%3Adef%3Acrs%3AEPSG%3A%3A3857&TYPENAME=Parks_and_Open_Spaces&bbox=-24190.549273477,6716902.930357,-23854.942946209,6717123.8811418 If I request the equivalent bounding box in EPSG:27700, I get this result: https://tilma.mysociety.org/mapserver/brent?SERVICE=WFS&VERSION=1.1.0&REQUEST=GetFeature&SRSNAME=urn%3Aogc%3Adef%3Acrs%3AEPSG%3A%3A27700&TYPENAME=Parks_and_Open_Spaces&bbox=523734.4667234342,183556.63528328092,523940.1889593812,183699.01999836136 The 3857 result is missing many of the entries present in the 27700 query (pink is 27700, red is 3857): The .map layer is: ``` LAYER NAME "Parks_and_Open_Spaces" METADATA "wfs_title" "parks_and_spaces" ##REQUIRED "wfs_srs" "EPSG:3857 EPSG:27700" ## REQUIRED "gml_include_items" "site_name" "gml_featureid" "site_name" ## REQUIRED "wfs_enable_request" "*" "wfs_getfeature_formatlist" "geojson" END TYPE POLYGON STATUS ON DATA 'brent/parks_and_open_spaces_poly' PROJECTION "init=epsg:27700" END END ``` and the source data is: [brent-parks.zip](https://github.com/MapServer/MapServer/files/13180576/brent-parks.zip) ## Operating system Debian bullseye ## MapServer version and installation method 7.6.2, Debian bullseye package If we run the same query on MapServer 7.2.2 (Debian buster), then we receive full results, 15 more entries in the 3857 response. No changes to data or map file.

comment.body:
Just as a reference because there may be no WFS server that behaves like they should by the WFS 1.1.0 standard:

> 14.3.3 Bounding box 
> The bounding box parameter, BBOX, is included in this specification for convenience as 
> a shorthand representation of the very common a bounding box filter which would be 
> expressed in much longer form using XML and the filter encoding described in [3].  A 
> BBOX applies to all feature types listed in the request.   
> The KVP encoding for a bounding box is defined in subclause 10.2.3 of normative 
> reference [15].  The general form of the parameter is: 
> BBOX=lcc1,lcc2,…,lccN,ucc1,ucc2,…uccN[,crsuri] 
> where lcc means Lower Corner Coordinate, ucc means Upper Corner Coordinate and 
> crsuri means the URI reference to the coordinate system being used.  This encoding 
> allows N coordinates for each corner listed in the order of the optional crsuri.  If the 
> crsuri is not specified then the 2-D coordinates shall be specified using decimal degrees 
> and WGS84 as described in [15].

issue.title: Missing stripes of information in tile raster output
issue.body:
## Expected behavior and actual behavior.

With:
* the Great Britain TIFF files downloaded from: https://osdatahub.os.uk/downloads/open/OpenMapLocal to and unpacked into the `/data/vhost/tilma.mysociety.org/rasters/openmap-local` directory;
* a tile index generated by `gdaltindex openmap-local.shp openmap-local/*.tif` run in the `/data/vhost/tilma.mysociety.org/rasters` directory;
* and this mapfile: https://github.com/mysociety/tilma/blob/beb0cb4b85bb0a25401d837d285db9077efb1696/web/os.map

I expect raster tiles to be generated without any missing information, just as they were with MapServer on Debian buster, but instead with Debian bullseye (or bullseye-backports, we've tried) some tiles now have missing stripes of output.

## Steps to reproduce the problem.

Tiles such as this: https://tilma.mysociety.org/mapserv.fcgi?map=os.map&VERSION=1.1.1&REQUEST=GetMap&SERVICE=WMS&STYLES=&BBOX=-198736.273541%2c6887281.996608%2c-198124.777315%2c6887893.492834&WIDTH=256&HEIGHT=256&FORMAT=image%2fpng&SRS=EPSG%3a3857&LAYERS=openmap-local have bands of missing data down the right hand edge:
![image](https://github.com/MapServer/MapServer/assets/154364/53021414-2eaa-4c45-b0e6-995fa2665ac6)

The next tile to the east - 
https://tilma.mysociety.org/mapserv.fcgi?map=os.map&VERSION=1.1.1&REQUEST=GetMap&SERVICE=WMS&STYLES=&BBOX=-198124.777315%2c6887281.996608%2c-197513.281089%2c6887893.492834&WIDTH=256&HEIGHT=256&FORMAT=image%2fpng&SRS=EPSG%3a3857&LAYERS=openmap-local - is fine:
![image](https://github.com/MapServer/MapServer/assets/154364/2532b8ab-435a-4d59-b9a5-0a06f7a328d3)

The tiles still contain the 'right' information, ie the stripe is meant to contain the missing data, it's not adding a 'gap'.

Or this one: https://tilma.mysociety.org/mapserv.fcgi?map=os.map&VERSION=1.1.1&REQUEST=GetMap&SERVICE=WMS&STYLES=&BBOX=-182225.875432%2c6895842.943775%2c-181614.379206%2c6896454.440002&WIDTH=256&HEIGHT=256&FORMAT=image%2fpng&SRS=EPSG%3a3857&LAYERS=openmap-local
![image](https://github.com/MapServer/MapServer/assets/154364/ca8f98f2-e13f-4550-8fa8-375dd16cf1bc)

This stripe starts at about 6927029.251316 N (about 30k to the north of this tile), then gets wider and wider the further south you go until it reaches that tile and then it disappears the tile underneath, which has no stripe at all. These bands appear to occur no more frequently than every 15km (each TIFF files is 5km by 5km).

We did not have this issue with Debian buster running 7.2.2, with the same TIFF files, same gdaltindex output, and same map file, which is why I am posting this as a bug report here rather than a support request. My apologies if there's something I've done to cause this, but I cannot see why the tiles would start behaving like this.

## Operating system

Debian bullseye

## MapServer version and installation method

Version 7.6.2 from Debian bullseye. We've also tried bullseye-backports (8.0.0) with the same output.

comment.body:
There are also horizontal stripes, and stripes sometimes only appear at a certain zoom level, e.g. this has no stripe:
https://tilma.mysociety.org/mapserv.fcgi?map=os.map&VERSION=1.1.1&REQUEST=GetMap&SERVICE=WMS&STYLES=&BBOX=-198124.777315%2c6875663.568308%2c-197513.281089%2c6876275.064534&WIDTH=256&HEIGHT=256&FORMAT=image%2fpng&SRS=EPSG%3a3857&LAYERS=openmap-local
![image](https://github.com/MapServer/MapServer/assets/154364/3290bc89-1fe6-43b0-996a-c283bfb1c10f)
But zooming in then does, at the bottom:
https://tilma.mysociety.org/mapserv.fcgi?map=os.map&VERSION=1.1.1&REQUEST=GetMap&SERVICE=WMS&STYLES=&BBOX=-198124.777315%2c6875969.316421%2c-197819.029202%2c6876275.064534&WIDTH=256&HEIGHT=256&FORMAT=image%2fpng&SRS=EPSG%3a3857&LAYERS=openmap-local
![image](https://github.com/MapServer/MapServer/assets/154364/28f3e2d4-4fc8-480e-852b-c5bc082f1d4d)

repo.description: Source code of the MapServer project.  Please submit pull requests to the 'main' branch.

commits.message:
Fix broken logic for geographic CRS template substitutions (#6953)

If the Map projection is a geographic coordinate system all  geographic CRS template substitutions will be skipped. This reintroduces them with reprojection only occurring if the map projection is a projected coordinate system

pull_request.title: Fix broken logic for geographic CRS template substitutions
pull_request.body: If the Map projection is a geographic coordinate system all geographic CRS template substitutions eg. [maplat] and [maplon] will be skipped. This reintroduces them with reprojection only occurring if the map projection is a projected coordinate system

issue.title: Internal server error using WFS GetFeature with resulttype=hits and outputformat=geojson
issue.body:
## Expected behavior and actual behavior.

The following request returns an Internal Server Error:
http://localhost:9906/maps/panden_plus2?service=WFS&version=2.0.0&request=GetFeature&typename=pand&bbox=130000,450000,140000,460000&resulttype=hits&outputformat=geojson
(The CRS is EPSG:28992, but adding this doesn't make a difference.)

I was expecting to get a JSON output indicating somehow, the feature count, although I don't even know if this is supposed to work. At least an Internal Server Error should not be thrown.

The logging to stdout/stderr shows this:
```
[Mon Sep 06 15:30:54.252990 2021] [fcgid:warn] [pid 4120:tid 140526833628928] [client 192.168.16.1:51382] mod_fcgid: error reading data, FastCGI server closed connection
[Mon Sep 06 15:30:54.253043 2021] [core:error] [pid 4120:tid 140526833628928] [client 192.168.16.1:51382] End of script output before headers: mapserv.fcgi
192.168.16.1 - - [06/Sep/2021:15:30:50 +0200] "GET /maps/panden_plus2?service=WFS&version=2.0.0&request=GetFeature&typename=pand&bbox=130000,450000,140000,460000&resulttype=hits&outputformat=geojson HTTP/1.1" 500 908 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:91.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/91.0"
[Mon Sep 06 15:30:54.935749 2021] [fcgid:error] [pid 4118:tid 140527389385856] mod_fcgid: process /usr/lib/cgi-bin/mapserv.fcgi(4176) exit(communication error), get unexpected signal 11
```

Relevant MapFile config:
```
  DEBUG 5
  CONFIG "MS_ERRORFILE" "stderr"
```


The following request returns a WFS FeatureCollection indicating the number of features:
http://localhost:9906/maps/panden_plus2?service=WFS&version=2.0.0&request=GetFeature&typename=pand&bbox=130000,450000,140000,460000&resulttype=hits

The only difference is that the `outputformat` parameter is omitted.

Result:
```xml
<?xml version='1.0' encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<wfs:FeatureCollection
   xmlns:panden="<redacted>"
   xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml/3.2"
   xmlns:wfs="http://www.opengis.net/wfs/2.0"
   xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
   xsi:schemaLocation="<redacted> http://localhost:9906/maps/panden?SERVICE=WFS&VERSION=2.0.0&REQUEST=DescribeFeatureType&TYPENAME=pand&OUTPUTFORMAT=application%2Fgml%2Bxml%3B%20version%3D3.2 http://www.opengis.net/wfs/2.0 http://schemas.opengis.net/wfs/2.0/wfs.xsd http://www.opengis.net/gml/3.2 http://schemas.opengis.net/gml/3.2.1/gml.xsd"
   timeStamp="2021-09-06T16:32:24" numberMatched="15000" numberReturned="0"
   next="http://localhost:9906/maps/panden?service=WFS&version=2.0.0&request=GetFeature&typename=pand&bbox=130000%2C450000%2C140000%2C460000">
</wfs:FeatureCollection>

```
As you can see, the numberMatched attribute holds the value of `15000`, which is the value I've set as the maximum number of features to be returned in a WFS request.

The logging is:
```
[Mon Sep 06 15:30:17.215981 2021] [fcgid:warn] [pid 4120:tid 140527336261376] [client 192.168.16.1:51374] mod_fcgid: stderr: CGI Request 2 on process 4175
[Mon Sep 06 15:30:17.216023 2021] [fcgid:warn] [pid 4120:tid 140527336261376] [client 192.168.16.1:51374] mod_fcgid: stderr: mapserv request processing time (msLoadMap not incl.): 4.159s
[Mon Sep 06 15:30:17.216029 2021] [fcgid:warn] [pid 4120:tid 140527336261376] [client 192.168.16.1:51374] mod_fcgid: stderr: msFreeMap(): freeing map at 0x55f4dde25700.
192.168.16.1 - - [06/Sep/2021:15:30:13 +0200] "GET /maps/panden_plus2?service=WFS&version=2.0.0&request=GetFeature&typename=pand&bbox=130000,450000,140000,460000&resulttype=hits HTTP/1.1" 200 925 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:91.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/91.0"
```


The following requests returns a GeoJSON file with 10 features:
http://localhost:9906/maps/panden_plus2?service=WFS&version=2.0.0&request=GetFeature&typename=pand&bbox=130000,450000,140000,460000&maxfeatures=10&outputformat=geojson

The only difference is that the `outputformat` parameter is replaced by the `maxfeatures` parameter (in order to limit the results).

Result:
```json
{
"type": "FeatureCollection",
"name": "pand",
"crs": { "type": "name", "properties": { "name": "urn:ogc:def:crs:EPSG::28992" } },
"features": [
{ "type": "Feature", "properties": { <redacted> }, "geometry": { "type": "Polygon", "coordinates": [ [ [ 132448.165, 459992.304 ], [ 132452.035, 459981.582 ], [ 132446.072, 459979.928 ], [ 132443.19, 459991.009 ], [ 132448.165, 459992.304 ] ] ] } }
<9 more features>
]
}
```


I've also tried to run the `mapserv` command in my Docker container, but in order for that to be working many different parameters need to be set. Apache is running as a non-root user. Perhaps the cause is a permission error, but it's strange that both GeoJSON is returned with a "normal' GetFeature request, and that the GML equivalent returns the expected result.


As for the probable cause: my primary suspicion is that there is no suitable place in a GeoJSON feature collection to hold the feature count. Perhaps the MapServer code is not able to handle this case. The error mentioned in the error log can have multiple causes, as mentioned here: https://serverfault.com/questions/364341/500-error-after-mod-fcgid-error.


## Steps to reproduce the problem.

See above.

## Attach simple test case (drag/drop it here)

Please let me know if additional info is required. 

## Operating system

Docker container with Linux (Debian Buster)

## MapServer version and installation method

I'm using MapServer version 7.6.4 on Linux (Debian Buster) in a Docker container, enabled by FastCGI in Apache.

comment.body:
I've enabled GeoJSON as an outputformat on the demo server (but please use the `MAXFEATURES` parameter to not overwork the server), so a request like this should work now:  https://demo.mapserver.org/cgi-bin/wfs?SERVICE=WFS&VERSION=2.0.0&REQUEST=getfeature&TYPENAMES=continents&OUTPUTFORMAT=geojson&MAXFEATURES=10

Let me know if that works for you locally.

issue.title: Internal server error using WFS GetFeature with resulttype=hits and outputformat=geojson
issue.body:
## Expected behavior and actual behavior.

The following request returns an Internal Server Error:
http://localhost:9906/maps/panden_plus2?service=WFS&version=2.0.0&request=GetFeature&typename=pand&bbox=130000,450000,140000,460000&resulttype=hits&outputformat=geojson
(The CRS is EPSG:28992, but adding this doesn't make a difference.)

I was expecting to get a JSON output indicating somehow, the feature count, although I don't even know if this is supposed to work. At least an Internal Server Error should not be thrown.

The logging to stdout/stderr shows this:
```
[Mon Sep 06 15:30:54.252990 2021] [fcgid:warn] [pid 4120:tid 140526833628928] [client 192.168.16.1:51382] mod_fcgid: error reading data, FastCGI server closed connection
[Mon Sep 06 15:30:54.253043 2021] [core:error] [pid 4120:tid 140526833628928] [client 192.168.16.1:51382] End of script output before headers: mapserv.fcgi
192.168.16.1 - - [06/Sep/2021:15:30:50 +0200] "GET /maps/panden_plus2?service=WFS&version=2.0.0&request=GetFeature&typename=pand&bbox=130000,450000,140000,460000&resulttype=hits&outputformat=geojson HTTP/1.1" 500 908 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:91.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/91.0"
[Mon Sep 06 15:30:54.935749 2021] [fcgid:error] [pid 4118:tid 140527389385856] mod_fcgid: process /usr/lib/cgi-bin/mapserv.fcgi(4176) exit(communication error), get unexpected signal 11
```

Relevant MapFile config:
```
  DEBUG 5
  CONFIG "MS_ERRORFILE" "stderr"
```


The following request returns a WFS FeatureCollection indicating the number of features:
http://localhost:9906/maps/panden_plus2?service=WFS&version=2.0.0&request=GetFeature&typename=pand&bbox=130000,450000,140000,460000&resulttype=hits

The only difference is that the `outputformat` parameter is omitted.

Result:
```xml
<?xml version='1.0' encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<wfs:FeatureCollection
   xmlns:panden="<redacted>"
   xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml/3.2"
   xmlns:wfs="http://www.opengis.net/wfs/2.0"
   xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
   xsi:schemaLocation="<redacted> http://localhost:9906/maps/panden?SERVICE=WFS&VERSION=2.0.0&REQUEST=DescribeFeatureType&TYPENAME=pand&OUTPUTFORMAT=application%2Fgml%2Bxml%3B%20version%3D3.2 http://www.opengis.net/wfs/2.0 http://schemas.opengis.net/wfs/2.0/wfs.xsd http://www.opengis.net/gml/3.2 http://schemas.opengis.net/gml/3.2.1/gml.xsd"
   timeStamp="2021-09-06T16:32:24" numberMatched="15000" numberReturned="0"
   next="http://localhost:9906/maps/panden?service=WFS&version=2.0.0&request=GetFeature&typename=pand&bbox=130000%2C450000%2C140000%2C460000">
</wfs:FeatureCollection>

```
As you can see, the numberMatched attribute holds the value of `15000`, which is the value I've set as the maximum number of features to be returned in a WFS request.

The logging is:
```
[Mon Sep 06 15:30:17.215981 2021] [fcgid:warn] [pid 4120:tid 140527336261376] [client 192.168.16.1:51374] mod_fcgid: stderr: CGI Request 2 on process 4175
[Mon Sep 06 15:30:17.216023 2021] [fcgid:warn] [pid 4120:tid 140527336261376] [client 192.168.16.1:51374] mod_fcgid: stderr: mapserv request processing time (msLoadMap not incl.): 4.159s
[Mon Sep 06 15:30:17.216029 2021] [fcgid:warn] [pid 4120:tid 140527336261376] [client 192.168.16.1:51374] mod_fcgid: stderr: msFreeMap(): freeing map at 0x55f4dde25700.
192.168.16.1 - - [06/Sep/2021:15:30:13 +0200] "GET /maps/panden_plus2?service=WFS&version=2.0.0&request=GetFeature&typename=pand&bbox=130000,450000,140000,460000&resulttype=hits HTTP/1.1" 200 925 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:91.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/91.0"
```


The following requests returns a GeoJSON file with 10 features:
http://localhost:9906/maps/panden_plus2?service=WFS&version=2.0.0&request=GetFeature&typename=pand&bbox=130000,450000,140000,460000&maxfeatures=10&outputformat=geojson

The only difference is that the `outputformat` parameter is replaced by the `maxfeatures` parameter (in order to limit the results).

Result:
```json
{
"type": "FeatureCollection",
"name": "pand",
"crs": { "type": "name", "properties": { "name": "urn:ogc:def:crs:EPSG::28992" } },
"features": [
{ "type": "Feature", "properties": { <redacted> }, "geometry": { "type": "Polygon", "coordinates": [ [ [ 132448.165, 459992.304 ], [ 132452.035, 459981.582 ], [ 132446.072, 459979.928 ], [ 132443.19, 459991.009 ], [ 132448.165, 459992.304 ] ] ] } }
<9 more features>
]
}
```


I've also tried to run the `mapserv` command in my Docker container, but in order for that to be working many different parameters need to be set. Apache is running as a non-root user. Perhaps the cause is a permission error, but it's strange that both GeoJSON is returned with a "normal' GetFeature request, and that the GML equivalent returns the expected result.


As for the probable cause: my primary suspicion is that there is no suitable place in a GeoJSON feature collection to hold the feature count. Perhaps the MapServer code is not able to handle this case. The error mentioned in the error log can have multiple causes, as mentioned here: https://serverfault.com/questions/364341/500-error-after-mod-fcgid-error.


## Steps to reproduce the problem.

See above.

## Attach simple test case (drag/drop it here)

Please let me know if additional info is required. 

## Operating system

Docker container with Linux (Debian Buster)

## MapServer version and installation method

I'm using MapServer version 7.6.4 on Linux (Debian Buster) in a Docker container, enabled by FastCGI in Apache.

comment.body:
Sorry, I was too busy when reading the description. GetFeature with resulttype=hits is a valid request and there is no way to tell in the GetCapabilities that GeoJSON is supported only for resulttype=results. But am I right that even when GeoJSON is returned it is missing these:
`timeStamp="2021-09-06T16:32:24" numberMatched="15000" numberReturned="0"`? So probably you would not get the answer that you wish even if you would not face the Internal Server Error.

The additional outputformats are not well defined in the WFS standard. Maybe user should consider that everything that works is nice extra and if something does not work then there is always the standard GML alternative. For example, outputformat shape-zip certainly is not 
practical for querying the hits.

Geoserver seems to be in the same situation, no JSON for hits https://gis.stackexchange.com/questions/213372/geoserver-wfs-request-resulttype-hits. I also remember seeing requests for getting DescribeFeatureType responses in JSON. Developers may not be so willing to improve the JSON support in WFS because the OGC API Features is natively all JSON.

Do you suggest reopening this issue?

issue.title: Internal server error using WFS GetFeature with resulttype=hits and outputformat=geojson
issue.body:
## Expected behavior and actual behavior.

The following request returns an Internal Server Error:
http://localhost:9906/maps/panden_plus2?service=WFS&version=2.0.0&request=GetFeature&typename=pand&bbox=130000,450000,140000,460000&resulttype=hits&outputformat=geojson

The following requests returns a GeoJSON file with 10 features:

The only difference is that the `outputformat` parameter is replaced by the `maxfeatures` parameter (in order to limit the results).

Result:
```json
{
"type": "FeatureCollection",
"name": "pand",
"crs": { "type": "name", "properties": { "name": "urn:ogc:def:crs:EPSG::28992" } },

<9 more features>
```

I've also tried to run the `mapserv` command in my Docker container, but in order for that to be working many different parameters need to be set. Apache is running as a non-root user. Perhaps the cause is a permission error, but it's strange that both GeoJSON is returned with a "normal' GetFeature request, and that the GML equivalent returns the expected result.

## Steps to reproduce the problem.

## Attach simple test case (drag/drop it here)

Please let me know if additional info is required. 

## Operating system

Docker container with Linux (Debian Buster)

## MapServer version and installation method

I'm using MapServer version 7.6.4 on Linux (Debian Buster) in a Docker container, enabled by FastCGI in Apache.

comment.body:
I'll retry with the latest version when I have time for it.
And as for the geojson format, I see that I've omitted an essential part of the config:
```
  OUTPUTFORMAT
    NAME "geojson"
    DRIVER "OGR/GEOJSON"
    MIMETYPE "application/json; subtype=geojson"
    FORMATOPTION "STORAGE=stream"
    FORMATOPTION "FORM=SIMPLE"
  END # OUTPUTFORMAT
```

In https://demo.mapserver.org/cgi-bin/wfs?SERVICE=WFS&VERSION=2.0.0&REQUEST=getcapabilities I see that only GML variants are allowed as output format, so, unless you change the configuration, you will never be able to reproduce my error with this service.

issue.title: MAP_RESOLUTION parameter
issue.body:
Hi,

I'm using MAP_RESOLUTION parameter extensively on WMS requests, specially to create print versions of maps, but it seems there is no documentation about it.

This is a request to add documentation about MAP_RESOLUTION.

Thank you :)

comment.body: As a WMS user I would rather like to see it in https://www.mapserver.org/ogc/wms_server.html#vendor-specific-wms-parameters.

issue.title: MAP_RESOLUTION parameter
issue.body:
Hi,

I'm using MAP_RESOLUTION parameter extensively on WMS requests, specially to create print versions of maps, but it seems there is no documentation about it.

This is a request to add documentation about MAP_RESOLUTION.

Thank you :)

comment.body: By removed I meant the more general mapfile modification syntax starting with _map__ or _map._. However, a few simple params like map_resolution and map_size were retained for backwards compatibility because of their widespread use. Plain RESOLUTION doesn't have any affect in your sample URLs (thanks for those) so it's only MAP_RESOLUTION that needs documentation. It really just needs a "see RESOLUTION" in the mapfile MAP section.

issue.title: MAP_RESOLUTION parameter
issue.body:
Hi,

I'm using MAP_RESOLUTION parameter extensively on WMS requests, specially to create print versions of maps, but it seems there is no documentation about it.

This is a request to add documentation about MAP_RESOLUTION.

Thank you :)

comment.body:
Removed? But it certainly it has some effect something. See the difference.

This is the default request from QGIS

https://demo.mapserver.org/cgi-bin/wms?SERVICE=WMS&VERSION=1.3.0&REQUEST=GetMap&BBOX=49.78082538500001419%2C15.65524312868486234%2C54.65824473983872167%2C22.30139697483871331&CRS=EPSG%3A4326&WIDTH=620&HEIGHT=455&LAYERS=cities&STYLES=&FORMAT=image%2Fpng&DPI=96&MAP_RESOLUTION=96&FORMAT_OPTIONS=dpi%3A96&TRANSPARENT=TRUE

with MAP_RESOLUTION edited 96 -> 600


https://demo.mapserver.org/cgi-bin/wms?SERVICE=WMS&VERSION=1.3.0&REQUEST=GetMap&BBOX=49.78082538500001419%2C15.65524312868486234%2C54.65824473983872167%2C22.30139697483871331&CRS=EPSG%3A4326&WIDTH=620&HEIGHT=455&LAYERS=cities&STYLES=&FORMAT=image%2Fpng&DPI=96&MAP_RESOLUTION=600&FORMAT_OPTIONS=dpi%3A96&TRANSPARENT=TRUE

The demo server is documented to run MapServer-git-main as of 2023-10-23.

issue.title: MAP_RESOLUTION parameter
issue.body:
Hi,

I'm using MAP_RESOLUTION parameter extensively on WMS requests, specially to create print versions of maps, but it seems there is no documentation about it.

This is a request to add documentation about MAP_RESOLUTION.

Thank you :)

comment.body: I need to check on this one. That general syntax was removed in 8.0 but may have been retained in some form...

issue.title: mapscript_csharp issue
issue.body:
Hello,
After upgrafing from Mapserver 7.0.2 to latest version 7.0.4 thru installing ms4w_3.2.0  and copied all dll's to my bin but I get an error when execute the map.draw() function:

{"drawGDAL(): Unable to access file. GDALDatasetRasterIO() failed: libpng: bad parameters to zlib"}
    [System.ApplicationException]: {"drawGDAL(): Unable to access file. GDALDatasetRasterIO() failed: libpng: bad parameters to zlib"}
    Data: {System.Collections.ListDictionaryInternal}
    HelpLink: null
    HResult: -2146232832
    InnerException: null
    Message: "drawGDAL(): Unable to access file. GDALDatasetRasterIO() failed: libpng: bad parameters to zlib"
    Source: "mapscript_csharp"


Could someone explain what I am missing and/or what file could not be accessed ? If any other info needed, let me know.

Update:
If I remove http WMS  layer from my map-file it works. Other layers are local shapes.

issue.title: mapscript_csharp issue
issue.body:
Hello,
After upgrafing from Mapserver 7.0.2 to latest version 7.0.4 thru installing ms4w_3.2.0  and copied all dll's to my bin but I get an error when execute the map.draw() function:

{"drawGDAL(): Unable to access file. GDALDatasetRasterIO() failed: libpng: bad parameters to zlib"}
    [System.ApplicationException]: {"drawGDAL(): Unable to access file. GDALDatasetRasterIO() failed: libpng: bad parameters to zlib"}
    Data: {System.Collections.ListDictionaryInternal}
    HelpLink: null
    HResult: -2146232832
    InnerException: null
    Message: "drawGDAL(): Unable to access file. GDALDatasetRasterIO() failed: libpng: bad parameters to zlib"
    Source: "mapscript_csharp"


Could someone explain what I am missing and/or what file could not be accessed ? If any other info needed, let me know.

Update:
If I remove http WMS  layer from my map-file it works. Other layers are local shapes.

comment.body: MapScript has changed, closing as outdated. Test with current versions and create new tickets if needed.

issue.title: Mapscript cannot compile with a static libmapserver
issue.body:
Whan attempting to compile Python Mapscript (I haven't tried any other flavour of Mapscript, but it stands to reason they'd encounter the same problem) with the static libmapserver, the linker throws an error about relocation: 
```
$ cmake .. -DLINK_STATIC_LIBMAPSERVER=1 -DWITH_PYTHON=1; make
[...]
/usr/bin/ld: ../../libmapserver_static.a(cgiutil.c.o): relocation R_X86_64_32 against `.rodata' can not be used when making a shared object; recompile with -fPIC
../../libmapserver_static.a: error adding symbols: Bad value
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
mapscript/python/CMakeFiles/_pythonmapscript.dir/build.make:143: recipe for target 'mapscript/python/_mapscript.so' failed
make[3]: *** [mapscript/python/_mapscript.so] Error 1
[...]
```

issue.title: Mapscript cannot compile with a static libmapserver
issue.body:
Whan attempting to compile Python Mapscript (I haven't tried any other flavour of Mapscript, but it stands to reason they'd encounter the same problem) with the static libmapserver, the linker throws an error about relocation: 
```
$ cmake .. -DLINK_STATIC_LIBMAPSERVER=1 -DWITH_PYTHON=1; make
[...]
/usr/bin/ld: ../../libmapserver_static.a(cgiutil.c.o): relocation R_X86_64_32 against `.rodata' can not be used when making a shared object; recompile with -fPIC
../../libmapserver_static.a: error adding symbols: Bad value
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
mapscript/python/CMakeFiles/_pythonmapscript.dir/build.make:143: recipe for target 'mapscript/python/_mapscript.so' failed
make[3]: *** [mapscript/python/_mapscript.so] Error 1
[...]
```

Hi,

I'm using MAP_RESOLUTION parameter extensively on WMS requests, specially to create print versions of maps, but it seems there is no documentation about it.

comment.body: I think that MAP_RESOLUTION is still undocumented. The mail thread that started the discussion is  https://lists.osgeo.org/pipermail/mapserver-users/2016-November/079524.html

issue.title: WFS GetFeature with attribute filter is null when "EXTENT" is not set
issue.body:
System : 
Ubuntu 16.04  
Mapserver 7.0.2
PostgreSQL 9.3.14 on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu, compiled by gcc (Ubuntu 4.8.4-2ubuntu1~14.04.3) 4.8.4, 64-bit
Postgis 2.1 

Description : 
mapfile without 'extent' tag give nothing on a WFS getFeature request WITH a attribute filter.  
maybe it's related to #5316, because the spatial intersection contain a polygon with coordinate near one.  
example of the SQL from PG log: 
```sql
select * 
    from dpop_criminalite_generale_v_s 
    where geom_s && ST_GeomFromText('POLYGON((-0.999999999977581   -0.999999700236674,-0.999999999977581 -0.999999700236674,-0.999999999977581   -0.999999700236674,-0.999999999977581 -0.999999700236674,-0.999999999977581   -0.999999700236674))',find_srid('','dpop_criminalite_generale_v_s','geom_s')) 
    
```
In my test, i saw different polygon when i changed the order of the "wfs_srs" in the METADATA of the layer.   
Without the attribute filter, the GetFeature request is working and i saw in the PG log a "st_extent" of the layer and the intersection is OK
 
Set the EXTENT with the projection of the EXTENT fix the problem.

issue.title: WFS GetFeature with attribute filter is null when "EXTENT" is not set
issue.body:
System : 
Ubuntu 16.04  
Mapserver 7.0.2
PostgreSQL 9.3.14 on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu, compiled by gcc (Ubuntu 4.8.4-2ubuntu1~14.04.3) 4.8.4, 64-bit
Postgis 2.1 

Description : 
mapfile without 'extent' tag give nothing on a WFS getFeature request WITH a attribute filter.  
maybe it's related to #5316, because the spatial intersection contain a polygon with coordinate near one.  
example of the SQL from PG log: 
```sql
select * 
    from dpop_criminalite_generale_v_s 
    where geom_s && ST_GeomFromText('POLYGON((-0.999999999977581   -0.999999700236674,-0.999999999977581 -0.999999700236674,-0.999999999977581   -0.999999700236674,-0.999999999977581 -0.999999700236674,-0.999999999977581   -0.999999700236674))',find_srid('','dpop_criminalite_generale_v_s','geom_s')) 
    
```
In my test, i saw different polygon when i changed the order of the "wfs_srs" in the METADATA of the layer.   
Without the attribute filter, the GetFeature request is working and i saw in the PG log a "st_extent" of the layer and the intersection is OK
 
Set the EXTENT with the projection of the EXTENT fix the problem.

comment.body: Closing even I am not totally sure if there could be something worth keeping the issue open.

issue.title: The WFS request add always a spatial filtering to the query sql.
issue.body:
Hi,
I notice the mapserver wfs when retrieving the data (I tested it using OGR provider and spatialite format for db) add always the casting to the query sql.

From the log of mapserver (debug 5 on layer)
I retrieve the filter applied to the dataset:
`
<wfs:GetFeature xmlns:wfs="http://www.opengis.net/wfs" xmlns:ogc="http://www.opengis.net/ogc" xmlns:ows="http://www.opengis.net/ows" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml" handle="GeoTools PO11.x.1 WFS DataStore" maxFeatures="1000" outputFormat="text/xml; subtype=gml/3.1.1" resultType="results" service="WFS" version="1.1.0">
 <wfs:Query srsName="urn:ogc:def:crs:EPSG::6707" typeName="rt_cat.idcatpart.bbox.rt">
  ogc:Filter
   ogc:And
    <ogc:PropertyIsLike escapeChar="!" matchCase="false" singleChar="?" wildCard="%">
     ogc:PropertyNamecomune/ogc:PropertyName
     ogc:Literal%FIRENZE%/ogc:Literal
    /ogc:PropertyIsLike
    <ogc:PropertyIsEqualTo matchCase="true">
     ogc:PropertyNamefoglionum/ogc:PropertyName
     ogc:Literal4/ogc:Literal
    /ogc:PropertyIsEqualTo
    <ogc:PropertyIsEqualTo matchCase="true">
     ogc:PropertyNameparticella/ogc:PropertyName
     ogc:Literal1/ogc:Literal
    /ogc:PropertyIsEqualTo
   /ogc:And
  /ogc:Filter
 /wfs:Query
/wfs:GetFeature

`The filter in ogr language , as reported from the log is this:

`
FLTLayerApplyPlainFilterToLayer():  ( ("[comune]" ~\* "._FIRENZE._") And ( ([foglionum] =4) And ([particella] =1)) ) , rect=529998.608791,4664917.066756,799986.281320,4949981.407214

`

And finally the query sql corresponding and applied to the db is this:
`
msOGRFileWhichShapes: SQL = SELECT ROWID AS msFID, \* FROM PARTICELLEBB WHERE (((CAST("comune" AS text) LIKE '%FIRENZE%') AND ((CAST("foglionum" AS REAL) = 4.000000) AND (CAST("particella" AS REAL) = 1.000000)))) AND PARTICELLEBB.ROWID IN (SELECT ROWID FROM SpatialIndex WHERE f_table_name = 'PARTICELLEBB' AND f_geometry_column = 'bbox' AND search_frame = GeomFromText('POLYGON((1529999.980909 4664923.376323,1800000.190426 4664923.376323,1800000.190426 4950073.173287,1529999.980909 4950073.173287,1529999.980909 4664923.376323))')).

`

As noticeable the query sql produced from mapser is adding a spatial filter to the BBOX of the dataset.

I dont understand why add this if the query filter in the request is not apply-ing any explicit data filter.

The time are very different because.
The query sql using the spatial filter (on an huge dataset) on dataset bbox take about 24 seconds to end.
Instead the query without the spatial filter but with the alphanumeric filters take about 0.01 seconds.

`
SELECT ROWID AS msFID, \* FROM PARTICELLEBB WHERE (((CAST("comune" AS text) LIKE '%FIRENZE%') AND ((CAST("foglionum" AS REAL) = 4.000000) AND (CAST("particella" AS REAL) = 1.000000))));

`

Hi,
I notice the mapserver wfs when retrieving the data (I tested it using OGR provider and spatialite format for db) add always the casting to the query sql.

From the log of mapserver (debug 5 on layer)

<wfs:GetFeature xmlns:wfs="http://www.opengis.net/wfs" xmlns:ogc="http://www.opengis.net/ogc" xmlns:ows="http://www.opengis.net/ows" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml" handle="GeoTools PO11.x.1 WFS DataStore" maxFeatures="1000" outputFormat="text/xml; subtype=gml/3.1.1" resultType="results" service="WFS" version="1.1.0">

    /ogc:PropertyIsLike

     ogc:Literal4/ogc:Literal
    /ogc:PropertyIsEqualTo
    <ogc:PropertyIsEqualTo matchCase="true">
     ogc:PropertyNameparticella/ogc:PropertyName
     ogc:Literal1/ogc:Literal
    /ogc:PropertyIsEqualTo
   /ogc:And
  /ogc:Filter

/wfs:GetFeature

`The filter in ogr language , as reported from the log is this:

`
FLTLayerApplyPlainFilterToLayer():  ( ("[comune]" ~\* "._FIRENZE._") And ( ([foglionum] =4) And ([particella] =1)) ) , rect=529998.608791,4664917.066756,799986.281320,4949981.407214

`

And finally the query sql corresponding and applied to the db is this:
`
msOGRFileWhichShapes: SQL = SELECT ROWID AS msFID, \* FROM PARTICELLEBB WHERE (((CAST("comune" AS text) LIKE '%FIRENZE%') AND ((CAST("foglionum" AS REAL) = 4.000000) AND (CAST("particella" AS REAL) = 1.000000)))) AND PARTICELLEBB.ROWID IN (SELECT ROWID FROM SpatialIndex WHERE f_table_name = 'PARTICELLEBB' AND f_geometry_column = 'bbox' AND search_frame = GeomFromText('POLYGON((1529999.980909 4664923.376323,1800000.190426 4664923.376323,1800000.190426 4950073.173287,1529999.980909 4950073.173287,1529999.980909 4664923.376323))')).

`

As noticeable the query sql produced from mapser is adding a spatial filter to the BBOX of the dataset.

I dont understand why add this if the query filter in the request is not apply-ing any explicit data filter.

The time are very different because.
The query sql using the spatial filter (on an huge dataset) on dataset bbox take about 24 seconds to end.
Instead the query without the spatial filter but with the alphanumeric filters take about 0.01 seconds.

`
SELECT ROWID AS msFID, \* FROM PARTICELLEBB WHERE (((CAST("comune" AS text) LIKE '%FIRENZE%') AND ((CAST("foglionum" AS REAL) = 4.000000) AND (CAST("particella" AS REAL) = 1.000000))));

`

comment.body:
The default filter can be removed with

> wfs_use_default_extent_for_getfeature
> 
> (Optional, since MapServer 7.0.4) Whether the MAP.EXTENT should be used in request to datasources in the absence of other spatial filter. This is the default behaviour, but this might affect performance in some use cases. In those cases, setting this item to “false” will avoid he default spatial filter to be appended to the request. This is only implemented for OGR datasources (since 7.0.4) and MSSQL2008 connections (since 7.6)
